errors.message: no metadata specified for the folder empty_folder so it was not taken into account
property url is required in resource image_book(bibType: image) and not present
property parent is required in resource m85(bibType: incollection) and not present
property format is required in resource temporal_data(bibType: tabularData) and not present
property format is required in resource temporal_data(bibType: tabularData) and not present
general metadata property test is invalid in section Partie 2.2 and therefore was not taken into account

contents.html: Welcome
<BlockContextualization id="contextualization_1" resources="@temporal_data" contextualizer="cool_timeline_1">A reference</BlockContextualization>
<BlockContextualization id="contextualization_2" resources="@temporal_data" contextualizer="cool_timeline_2">Another view on the timeline</BlockContextualization>
I will talk about that[^]{with a footnote here} :
<BlockContextualization id="contextualization_4" resources="@temporal_data" contextualizer="contextualizer_3">Another reference with unnamed contextualizer</BlockContextualization>
I will first quote in a book where someone that says it's not possible.
Then I should have an ibid here [^]{.}
And as say a lot of people[^]{}, publishing could be simpler.
And for the footnotes, I want to say that Martin said that[^]{I'm referencing to when he says : "hello"}
Whe Martin says there has to be some change.
Now let's say I want to link to this timeline and continue my paragraph quietly.
Welcome to my awesome book.
Thanks to all !
Momanddad The dog My imaginary friend Serge
I am just there, not linked to content.md. I should be put at the end of content by alphabetical order.
